website_summaries.verdict: An all-natural baked treat that’s flawlessly proportioned for small dogs.
pros: A crunchy, grain-free alternative made with natural ingredients and flavors like peanut butter, bananas, potatoes, peas, and cane molasses
The perfect size for small to medium sized breeds
cons: Big dogs will go through these biscuits quickly

customer_reviews.title: Gave my puppy bad diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this dog biscuit after reading great reviews. I used them as training reward for my puppy and it gave him bad diarrhea and sleepless nights for me and my family. I could not figure out this was the culprit the first time when my puppy had diarrhea. After weeks of bland diet, shedding and weight loss finally got him back on healthy condition. Used this as a training treat second time and he had no other treats other than this and his regular kibble. Triggered diarrhea again.
customer_reviews.author: Venkat

customer_reviews.title: best biscuit style treat I've found
customer_reviews.text: I bought the mini sized treat, which is the perfect size for my 12lb Boston Terrier. When the 3.5lb bag came, I was shocked at how many treats were in it. At one treat a day, the bag could easily last 2 to 3 months. I decided to take some treats to work, I am an Animal Control Officer. So far dogs of all breeds, sizes, and temperments seem to enjoy them. I can give them to other people's dogs with confidence because all of the indredients are easy to read and are identifiable.
customer_reviews.author: diane

customer_reviews.title: Not sure....
customer_reviews.text: I've bought these before from local pet stores..very good product.. so I decided to order a larger quantity on Amazon... Nice packing job from Amazon but once I opened the box the bag that they came in wasn't sealed at all... Seems kinda hokey honestly... Gave one biscuit to one of my dogs who usually inhales these and she dropped it and was like WTH.... So I'm thinking they are stale... Back to the local pet store for me....
customer_reviews.author: brian m caine

customer_reviews.title: I feel horrible I was giving my dogs treats that had bugs
customer_reviews.text: received my box in august and could not understand why I was having little moths bugs that fly in my room. Today went to refill the dog cookie jar and opened the box of dog treat cookies and bag was full of bugs. I feel horrible I was giving my dogs treats that had bugs. I always loved these dog treats the company should be more carefull I threw the box away no more bugs in my room.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Peters

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves these treats and we are on auto ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these treats and we are on auto ship; however the last bags (2) we received were stale. That is unusual for the quality of this product so we needed to buy another product from a local pet store.
customer_reviews.author: Curryspace

customer_reviews.title: I made a terrible mistake.
customer_reviews.text: I made a terrible mistake..I have ordered these for years but did not pay attention to the price..it is the smallest most expensive bag of Mother Hubbard treats I have ever received..I could have bought a much larger size for the same price..I am very cross with myself..why does this little bag have to cost as much as the bigger sizes????
customer_reviews.author: peace w. baxter

customer_reviews.title: Lower Quality than Smaller bags
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these cookies, and I've been using these (split in half) for training, and since I would go through two of the 5oz bags of these in a week, I thought I'd save some money and get the big box of these. While my dog doesn't notice a quality difference, I definitely did. ingredients are the same, but the look and feel of the cookies are definitely inferior to the smaller more expensive (per cookie) bags. I've included a photo comparing the cookies, the one on the left is from the smaller bags, the one on the right is from the larger box I bought.
customer_reviews.author: zaise

customer_reviews.title: Great dog biscuits. Mini size is perfect for small dogs
customer_reviews.text: Puppy loves them. The mini size is perfect to stuff a few into a medium Kong with some peanut butter. Even though they are crunchy "feel" fresh in that if you want to break it up into smaller pieces it is not difficult. I got milkbones one time because they were cheap but even the small ones were way to big to fit in a Kong and they were very difficult to break in half. The difference in quality with these is obvious!
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Treats arrived in bad condition and expired
customer_reviews.text: This bag arrived yesterday, I have ordered multiple times before. As you can see in pics the bag looks rough, the packaging is worn. The date of expiration on the bag is 8/2/18 as seen in the pic, today’s date is 8/29/18. I’m not going through the trouble to send these back for a $2.79 bag of treats, these are going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Not going back to Milkbone
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs love their cookies. Over the years, I've purchase regular Milkbone biscuits and they've been perfectly happy with them. I like the Milkbone brand because of the price and the large boxes I can buy. I decided to try these cookies when on an Amazon buying spree and Milkbone weren't available. Guess I'm not going back because our dogs LOVE these cookies. They even know where the cookie jar is and stand near it and stare after they go outside. Don't know what makes them different, but they want treats more now than ever!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Burned Biscuits-AGAIN!  Large size
customer_reviews.text: I contacted Old Mother Hubbard several years ago because of frustration of multiple purchases of bags with burned biscuits.(Thought was one-off type issue). Biscuits scorched on bottom and ends of top. They refunded money. After not buying for several years,I just bought another bag(my dogs liked) but same failure. The burned always on top. This particular bag also had lots!! of broken pieces. If you don't let companies know about the poor quality, they can't fix. Will also contact Old Mother Hubbard.
customer_reviews.author: robred99

customer_reviews.title: We Love Old Mother Hubbard Treats!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love Old Mother Hubbard treats and I love them too because of the ingredients that they put into each a every one. Good wholesome natural ingredients like, carrots, oats, apples, rosemary extract, green tea extract, whole wheat flour. Ingredients I can pronounce and know what they are. I love the fact that Old Mother Hubbard has been around for awhile, since 1926, and their recipe has not changed over the years. I love that they have so many different flavors AND one for their teeth and breath. I'm very happy giving my "fur-babies" Old Mother Hubbard treats and snacks because I know their made with care and lots of love, especially from me!!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca J Holyfield

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs with sensitive stomachs!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog has an EXTREMELY sensitive stomach. The only food/treats that don't upset her stomach are Hills prescription diet for food sensitivities. But these Mother Hubbard treats do not upset her stomach and she LOVES them! :) the mini biscuits fit perfectly inside a medium sized Kong too! Highly recommend these treats to anyone who has a dog with a sensitive stomach!
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: Check your bag,
customer_reviews.text: I always do this because I am afraid of critters coming in with grain products, I found them in one bag and just threw it out. I was not happy but did not figure it would help to complain. This time I just put the bag in where I keep my pet foods. Stupid me did not check. It was filled with the same kind of small beetles that the other bag was. I had to throw everything out because they will spread. You don't mess with bugs in Florida. Lots of money wasted. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: V. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Crushed!
customer_reviews.text: These dog biscuits are great...I've been buying them for my Borders for several years and they love them. But my last order was ruined. Almost every biscuit was broken, many into gravel and a lot into dust! Why? They were shipped in the same box as three (3)!!! cases of canned dog, with no padding or other protection. Almost everyone knows NOT to enclose fragile products in a box with heavy items. It was like putting individual eggs in the box alongside 4 iron anvils and then shipping the box strapped to a galloping horse! Otherwise, I would have given 5 starts to this superior product!
customer_reviews.author: Edie

customer_reviews.title: Probably will not purchase again
customer_reviews.text: First let me say that I believe animals have souls. True or not, I don’t know. But my dogs would sell theirs for these treats. I bought the 20 pounds because they love them. Received the box today. Opened the cardboard box and there were the treats sitting wide open in cheap plastic. VERY DISAPPOINTED!!!! I guess I will find out if they are spoiled when and if my dogs get sick!!! Listen for over 50 bucks, can they at least be sealed when I receive my order?!?!?!?! Probably won’t buy again.
customer_reviews.author: intermediate player

customer_reviews.title: both dogs threw up these biscuts
customer_reviews.text: MY 4 yr old and 6 1/2 month both threw up the biscuts, each had a different color amber and dark green.... calling Mother HUBBARD, CHECK YOUR NUMBER AT THE BOTTOM OF BOX 76344 10171 IT WAS TOO LATE TO RETURN, USUALLY BUY milk bones , back to them thought I'd give dogs a change.
customer_reviews.author: Diane VK

customer_reviews.title: Cookies for Fido
customer_reviews.text: Our 4-legged child, Kai used to like a softer treat. After a few years he started turning his nose away. I read about this treat in "Your Dog Newsletter from Tufts University" After finding this on Amazon I opted for multiple bags of Old Mother Hubbard (5 oz.) assortment. There hasn't been a day that Kai has not eaten this treat, plus it's lower in calories than his previous treat. I will order this again.
customer_reviews.author: Patty C

customer_reviews.title: Love these treats!
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying these treats for our dog Sammy for years and he never grows tired of them! He remembers every night that he gets to play 'hide and seek' with these treats and he will look high and low until he finds them. If he hasn't found them all he will come into the family room and stare at us until we get up and check to see if there are any outstanding! Love the variety and the size is perfect for our 20 lb dog and for tucking away in small places so he has to work to find them. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Johnson

customer_reviews.title: My dog eats pretty much anything and he actually hesitates to take this ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog eats pretty much anything and he actually hesitates to take this treat and then leaves it on the ground. I can't understand why. He has had numerous other treats and wolfs them down as quick as I can give them to him.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Torrington

customer_reviews.title: The dogs like it
customer_reviews.text: I have three large dogs and I tend to look for more healthy treats for them these days. I also prefer things made in the USA. These aren't made here, but at least it's North America (they are made in Canada) and they are labeled as "natural" and claim to have no artificial ingredients. I can't attest to anything except for what's on the label, but I like the size of the treat and there's no yucky smell that sometimes accompanies treats. I read reviews and have bought these for my dogs for the last few months. They love them.
customer_reviews.author: Orrymain

customer_reviews.title: Bugs in the cookies
customer_reviews.text: My service dog loves these cookies, but our last package has bugs in it. I had to throw the whole package away. When I received the bag, I sealed it in a plastic bag because I was using up the last bag I got, so I know the bugs came in the package. I'm really disappointed because this is my dog's favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Sagewoman8

customer_reviews.title: Two of my beagles became very ill after first Peanut Butter cookie
customer_reviews.text: We have been using Mother Hubbard dog biscuits for decades. Decided to try the peanut butter-flavored cookies. Both dogs threw-up most of the day. One is either shivering, trying to get comfortable, or looking for a place to throw-up again. I do not recommend taking the chance with these peanut-butter-flavored cookies. AMAZON: Please enable some means of submitting a COMPLAINT about a product that is independent of the Review, Question-Answer, or Return/Refund processes. Recommend stopping the sale of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Big bag, natural products
customer_reviews.text: A lot comes in this bag and the little crunchy treats are bone shaped and perfect for the size of my 10 lb dog. I put 1/2 in a large container for on the counter and the rest in the freezer for later. That was several months ago and she gets 1-2 of these a day, so one bag will last a long time. It is difficult to say if they are tasty to my dog as she will eat anything, but I researched this before buying and bought because it did not have additives and unnatural fillings. Also made in the USA. She seems to really enjoy them and I will purchase more when I finally run out.
customer_reviews.author: ddw

customer_reviews.title: Lmited variety, seems fresh and no funny odors. Smells like real food.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love the taste of Old Mother hubbard treats. I buy about 25 -30lbs of them a month. They each have their favorite flavor and this assortment bag helps with that. There are only 4 flavors, I wish it had more variety. The least favorite for any of my dogs is the char tar ones. I only have one dog out of 12 that like them. They always seem fresh when I open them. No fuuny odors. Overall my fur babies really like most of Old Mother Hubbard things though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small bite sized treats
customer_reviews.text: Small bite size biscuits about 1.5" in length. My dog is small / 20 lbs in size, and these are a good size for her. However, she likes them well but doesn't go bonkers over them like other more 'junk food' type dog treats. They are a good basic treat staple, though, and easy to transport a few of them in my backpack when my dog and I go on outdoor adventures.
customer_reviews.author: mb123

customer_reviews.title: dog doesn't like
customer_reviews.text: My dog doesn't really seem to like these. He gets excited and anxious for certain treats and this is not one of them. I think he begrudgingly has eaten a number of these but not with same enthusiasm he does for others. My dog never ever leaves a treat behind but a couple of times he has left these behind. I don't necessarily blame the product, but thats how my experience went with it.
customer_reviews.author: VelocityTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised or described.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two (2) of the large treats and neither bag had any Char Tar flavor treats. The product description and packaging claim an assortment of original, chicken, cheddar and char tar flavor treats. There are only two different color treats in each bag which indicates only two flavors. I have purchased all three sizes of Mother Hubbard treats so I am familiar that each flavor is a different color. The only reason I gave it rating of 2 is that my dog does enjoy the treats.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Far better than milk-bone
customer_reviews.text: Wife was feeding them biscotti along with her in the AM and her coffee / tea regiment. Those bags of biscotti were costing me $7.50 -- too much for a dog. Tried to find an alternative. These are great. Not too hard; not too soft; no longer making them long for her biscotti. Highly, highly recommend. Don't think the dogs have shown any preference to color / flavor. Bulk is best in these situations. Several different sizes. Look at the buying information.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Valstar

customer_reviews.title: Hard to judge
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure these treats are fine, but my dog won't eat them. He buries them instead. Maybe I should be reviewing my dog instead of these treats.
customer_reviews.author: akush47

customer_reviews.title: Great treat for our dog
customer_reviews.text: I love that this treat is both good for our dog and he loves them. So much better than the horrible milk bones. We feed high quality food to our boy and he will not be given treats that are not top notch. We go through a large bag every month and have this on our Subscribe and Save.
customer_reviews.author: David K

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly, My Dog Doesn't Like Them
customer_reviews.text: She likes everything. I have to watch her like a hawk when we're walking because she'll eat anything. When I offer one of these biscuits, she smells them, takes them in her mouth, then drops them on the ground and walks off. It's a behavior I've never seen before. I'm guessing that the remainder will end up in the garbage can.
customer_reviews.author: Nightrunner

customer_reviews.title: Healthy ingredients that doggies love makes us all happy!!
customer_reviews.text: If Old Mother Hubbard had these doggie biscuits in her cupboard, then mostly certainly it was bare!! Bought them because the name was cute, my dog LOVED them!!! She's 60lbs, but I purchased the mini size, p-nuttier flavor. All natural ingredients, so it's a healthy treat. Fresh and flavorful according to Blossom Zelene! I have already ordered another bag and is now on my buy again list. Great price, healthy ingredients, flavorful. Win-Win all around!
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: 🐶 A winner in taste & size
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I tried this brand of dog treats. The dog treats arrived fresh. They do not come in a re-sealable bag, so I transferred them to a ziploc. I bought them for my Folks' miniature schnauzer. He is a 19 lb guy and absolutely loves these treats. He could not eat them fast enough. The dog biscuit's size is just right to where he can chew on it and I do not have to break up the biscuit for him. I will be buying these again.
customer_reviews.author: Anya Z. 🌻

customer_reviews.title: Smell great
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea why these smell so good, and they have all sorts of chemicals in them to keep them fresh, but my 35 lb hound loves them. They are not one bite for her, so they are best to give when she can pick up the bits when they fall out of her mouth, like after a long walk or when she sits at the corner without being asked. I love how nice they smell, compared to some other name brands that don't use good ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: BecsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Smells great but dogs not crazy about them.
customer_reviews.text: The biscuits are packaged nicely and smell great, but the three dogs I bought them for aren't terribly fond of them. They take them when I offer them but then drop them and don't seem to want to eat them. Eventually they do eat them, but not enthusiastically. I've never had that happen before, so as much as they look and smell tasty to me, the dogs don't seem to agree. I won't be reordering these again.
customer_reviews.author: On-line Shopper

customer_reviews.title: My Shichon loves these!
customer_reviews.text: These little bones are great for small dogs. My puppy (Shih Tzu / Bichon Frise, 11 months old) loves them. They only last her a few minutes, but they're great for trying to catch the naughty little thing when she doesn't want to be caught. I walk over to the closet where they're kept and she's instantly on my heels. These have saved me when my very intelligent, difficult-to-train pet tries to outmaneuver me and can easily outrun me. For this price, they're a great deal. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: alison_eve

customer_reviews.title: Great value if you have the space
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these treats, and I've been buying the small bags that just fill his treat jar. The 20-lb. box is a much better value, if you have the room. The product quality is the same. The treats come in a cardboard box with a plastic bag liner. I would favor a sturdier liner, but this one is adequate so long as the box remains dry and out of reach of pests.
customer_reviews.author: Copwriter

customer_reviews.title: Old Mother Hubbard Crunchy Classic Dog Treats
customer_reviews.text: Old Mother Hubbard Crunchy Classic Dog Treats was a good deal for me because I live in a rural area in a small town and a tiny bag of dog treats at the country market is almost the same price as this big box... My dog likes them but what dog doesn’t like dog treats
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Dog seems to love them
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally ordered the large size for my 8 pound Maltese/Poodle, and was surprised at how HUGE these actually are anyway. I would only recommend buying the large if you have a really big dog like a Great Dane or Newfoundland. Unfortunately, I made the mistake of opting to break them instead of exchanging them. They are extremely difficult to break and I have to use a hammer. However, my dog really seems to like them. I would recommend them, just be sure to order the correct size. (I saw these in a store after receiving them and see I would need small rather than mini, which unfortunately was not an option here)
customer_reviews.author: Skylar T.

customer_reviews.title: I do order them in bulk like this and it normally last me about 4 months ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been a fan of these for years and have used them probably over 10 years. I do order them in bulk like this and it normally last me about 4 months and that is with 4 dogs giving them treats at night when they go potty and come in for the night. These are great because they are bite size so if you like you can use them also as training treats especially when broken in half
customer_reviews.author: Kimberry Massey

customer_reviews.title: Packaging inhales deeply
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in how the inner packaging is sealed.... Or, rather lack there of... A think plastic bag, not sealed, not even twisted shut with a bread twist tie. C'mon Mother Hubbard, I know ya'll can do better.
customer_reviews.author: Mermaid222

customer_reviews.title: Garlic is toxic to dogs
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, these are now in my garbage pail. After noticing that the ingredients contained garlic I called my vet to see if it was OK to give to my dog. Everyone knows that garlic is toxic to dogs but I wanted to be sure. My vet said that she could not tell me to let my dog eat them in good conscience. On a positive note the company reimbursed me and did not make me return them.
customer_reviews.author: L.M.T.

customer_reviews.title: Beware: live insects
customer_reviews.text: I've gotten these without issue from Amazon probably a dozen times, and my dogs like them, but my latest order included live insects?! They appeared to be fleas as they were small like a fruit fly but would jump very fast. I'm not sure how many there were because they seem to hide inside the little holes on either end of the bone shapes but I found three. I won't be buying these again.
customer_reviews.author: Eryn

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves these!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these. They are his “night night cookie” and I give him half of one after he does outside to potty before bed. I order the large when I should have ordered the medium so I have to break them in half or they are huge. This is a good product at a good price. Sam is a huge fan and has been getting them as part of his nighttime training since we got him at 4 months. He’s a year and a half now.
customer_reviews.author: Allison in ATL

customer_reviews.title: Dogs Don't Like Them
customer_reviews.text: The quality of these are good but our dogs don't like them. Our dogs (basset hounds and beagles) will eat just about anything but...they snub their noses at these and won't even try to taste them. I'm bummed that I bought such a big bag of them because the rest will just go in the trash :(.
customer_reviews.author: Breezyk

customer_reviews.title: Good training treats
customer_reviews.text: I use these bickies for treating my dogs for certain routine behavioral choices throughout the day. Whole, they are a great size for large dogs; and, they easily snap into pieces for smaller dogs. They have been one of my 'go to' brands for years, both because of their simple ingredients and because they can be left in open air containers in various locations around the house. Both my own dogs and all our fosters like them.
customer_reviews.author: KGM

customer_reviews.title: My dogs loves these
customer_reviews.text: We've been feeding these treats for at least a year. At first, Lincoln would kind of turn up his nose because he was used to getting something else. But now, he wolfs down dinner as fast as he can, then goes and stands by the cabinet waiting for his dessert. If your dog doesn't immediately take to them, just give him time. He'll eventually come around...
customer_reviews.author: Brenda B.

customer_reviews.title: Large, Hard, Crunchy, Dry
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't expecting the weight being heavy. It's a lot of Large Bones. There're very dense; well made and very hard. When the dog bites into it; the crumbs are very small. (like a thick biscuit). My 50 lb. dog loves them!!! Very well packaged and very well made. There're hard to break in half yourself because they are so well made and very hard. Let the dog break it up and eat it. He'll be occupied a few minutes with each treat!
customer_reviews.author: BrianB

customer_reviews.title: Picky Dog Approved
customer_reviews.text: My dog has copper storage disease so she can't have products that contain sweet potato, peanut butter, or other common dog treat ingredients. She took to these treats like a fish to water--absolutely loves them. They do smell a little funky because of the smoke-bacon smell and cheese, but as long as you keep the bag sealed it's not an issue. The large biscuits can be easily broken apart or cut by a knife which is useful for medium dogs, or dogs that are on a diet. Do recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: Dog approved
customer_reviews.text: We try and feed our dogs high quality food, and treats, and one of our rescue dogs (staffy bull) is really picky about food. She likes these guys though, except for the tan colored ones, she'll sometimes spit those out for her non-picky, American Bully brother to eat. He loves all of the flavors/colors. We keep these in their 'cookie can' and they both come running when we shake it. Great sized treat, even for bigger dogs, and we can give them 6 or 7 of them without fear of overfeeding.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: Not fresh, too hard to chew or break in half
customer_reviews.text: I’m pretty disappointed in this package. The treats are so hard that I can’t break them. My dog, who is only 15 lbs, can’t break them so he can’t eat them. They’re laying around the house. It makes me sad because we bought the big bag. I’ve had the smaller bags previously and they were great. I’m assuming they’re over cooked or old. Update- I ordered a different bag and they’re a totally different color, breakable and my pup ate them!! What a waste of $7 for a big bag!
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn

customer_reviews.title: But the smell was horrible. They smelled rancid
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the extra small biscuits, when they came they were opened and all over everything else in the box. But the smell was horrible. They smelled rancid. Would never feed them to my dog. Now I ordered the Small ones last times, had to break them in half and they were fine, but these were terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Toni*

customer_reviews.title: Great ingredients, great quality, great value
customer_reviews.text: Title says it all. These treats are made really well with ingredients I'm very comfortable giving my dogs. They have all the nutritional information printed clearly on the bag & I really trust the brand. My German Shepherd has GI problems & a lot of treats bother his stomach, but these have never been an issue. Plus, the amount you get in these bags is a bargain you can't pass up. My only wish is that they made them in an even smaller size so I could use them more frequently!
customer_reviews.author: Ro

customer_reviews.title: Delicious and healthy
customer_reviews.text: We have been using Mother Hubbard biscuits for more than 10 years. All the different breeds of dogs love them, the Anatolians, St. Bernards, Whippets, Greyhounds, spaniels, Pekingese and Brussels Griffons. We are particularly fond of the small size liver biscuits. Our little dogs think these are a great treat and gobble them up, which is important as we don't want a small dog to miss any meals. Really healthy and delicious.
customer_reviews.author: Baroness Alix

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love these!
customer_reviews.text: I've been giving these to my dogs for years. They're perfect because they're small enough that I don't worry about overfeeding them by giving them a couple treats per day, but they're big enough to be a substantial treat for my large dogs. The price is perfect and great value for the money. We always have these in the dog treat jar.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M

customer_reviews.title: YUMMY (Or so I'm told..)
customer_reviews.text: I'm very choosey when it comes to everything that I give to my pibble. These, I gladly give to him. He gets beyond excited when he wakes up in the morning, and especially at bedtime, because he knows he's going to get his 'nite-nite cookies'. I laugh at him constantly, because as soon as I reach into the bag, the rivers of drool start to flow. He has a few different treats he gets, but based on the drool rating, these are his favorite. Dudley rates them 'Three Streams!!'
customer_reviews.author: Alpha Dog

customer_reviews.title: A good biscuit, but bad shipping
customer_reviews.text: A good biscuit, but bad shipping. I received a bag of big crumbs. A few were whole, but most were mashed and crumbled. They came in a box but were a mess. Have to give my dog crumbs. Disappointed in the shipping but the bones that were whole he liked. Over half unusable as a treat. Won't order again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t not feed this to your pet
customer_reviews.text: After giving these treats to three of my small dogs. All three got sick really bad. Two of them are vomiting & won’t even eat. This entire whole situation has been a nightmare. Please don’t not give these treats to your furry friends. :( Update: Sad to say, my pet ended up passing away. I took him to the vet. The doctor said, he had a high fever and stomach ulcers. I feel so awful about feeding these treats to my pet. Please, don’t waste your money on this poison.
customer_reviews.author: S. Groves

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love them, but too many bones are always broken upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: We have a standing monthly order for the 20lb box of Old Mother Hubbard large biscuits. As one would expect, our order arrives with a few broken biscuits and some biscuit dust. Unfortunately, we seem to end up with several broken bones. The best box we received was 206 bones arrived intact. The most recent box had 162 bones intact and we have had a delivery where almost half of them were broken. We have 5 labs and it's best if we can receive the large biscuits as intact as possible. Is anyone else having this issue with the 20lb box?
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Scottie Dog Likes These O.K.
customer_reviews.text: We were spoiled to IAMS Puppy Biscuits but they became hard to find and Old Mother Hubbard has been a satisfactory replacement for the past 3 years. MacTavish is very spoiled and pampered but he likes these most of the time and they break in half easily to keep his weight in check. We also recommend this brands "Hip and Joint" treats. Good quality, fair price make this brand a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Major T

customer_reviews.title: My dog doesn't like them.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to write a bad review, because I can't say that I personally have tried these treats. I bought them because they are low on calories and my lil chubby could narrow out a bit, but she only takes them if I refuse to give her anything else. Then she hides them for a rainy day. I keep finding them everywhere. I guess it hasn't rained enough yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia Martin

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves 'em!
customer_reviews.text: These are great...just know that it is not the best way to keep your dog's weight down, but all things in moderation. This is our goto daily treat for our beagle lab mix. She loves them and we love her. Highly recommend. Amazon tells me that I have bought these things 12 times...lol. Sourcing elsewhere now. Amazon's choice.
customer_reviews.author: Faja4x

customer_reviews.title: Great treats, INSANE price increase.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful treats! However the review is in regards to the crazy price increase. We purchase the 20lb box once a year, and our dogs love them to the very last bit. So imagine my surprise when I went to purchase a new box, a little under a year later, and saw an increase in price that came to around 65%! I expect a small increase in a year, but 65% is insane. Looks like our dogs will be getting different treats.
customer_reviews.author: A R.

customer_reviews.title: Very good dog snacks, owner confident in ingredients
customer_reviews.text: Our Boston, Frenchie mix loves this variety of snacks and they are of good size too. They are pricey compared to Costco treats, but they safely provided multi flavors and a good ingredient list. Our dog loves them. I will buy once or twice a year in between Costco snacks monthly for extra happy times/seasons/holidays...
customer_reviews.author: J.E.

customer_reviews.title: INFESTED WITH BUGS AND MAGGOTS
customer_reviews.text: Wer received the box and I transferred the bisquits to my dog's metal treat box. I went to give my dog one and it was infested with brown bugs and maggots. WHY this company hasn't any quality control is beyond me. DO NOT PURCHASE THESE. I submitted for a refund through Amazon. I will never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly A. Libersher

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves these, but need to size down!
customer_reviews.text: My Boston Terrier LOVES Mother Hubbard treats. We normally buy the mini size, but they are quite tiny, so I figured I would try the small. The small seems fine until my dog tries to eat it, and then either almost chokes or has to chew it into a million little pieces. I would suggest the mini size for any 25-30lb dog.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: I don't love them but my dogs do!!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't love them because I have never tasted them, but if my dogs are any indication, these are the best treats they ever had. My lab loves them so much that as soon as you give him one he looks at you like "When you going to give me a treat" because the first one is gone that quickly! He would eat the whole bag if I kept flipping him one. This is one thing, that if I throw it across the room, he isn't going to retrieve it and bring it back to me.
customer_reviews.author: Ragin Cajun Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Seems good quality and dog approves 100%
customer_reviews.text: I saw there might have been issues in the past so I inspected the packaging carefully. Seems fresh to me. Dog approves 100% and I feel better knowing it's better quality than the cheapo ones at the store. I bought the 6 lb small biscuit assorted. I would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: NB Buyer

customer_reviews.title: My 3 dogs didn't like these!!
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 dogs. One is a little pi ky but the other 2 will eat anything I give them. None of them like these treats. I have got this brand before in different flavors and they loved them. I bought the 3 pound bag so it would last. So I have 3 lbs of waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Davenport

customer_reviews.title: Bug infested box
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased this items several times in the past without issue but this last batch was infested with bugs. There were worm like larvae crawling inside the bag. Some of the larvae were fully developed into what looked like moths. Pretty gross.... fyi when the box comes the biscuits are inside a thin plastic bag that isn't even sealed. So presumably bugs could have crawled in during shipping or they could have been infested at the factory who knows. Will not be buying this brand again...
customer_reviews.author: RubberMushroom

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves them but got a bad bag.
customer_reviews.text: I’m on my second or third bag. My 10 yr old German shepherd mix loves them. But this last bag, I opened it and reached in and i found about 1/3 of the bones bad. Moldy perhaps? I went to amazon and, as always, they were wonderful giving me a return. I am bummed bc my dog loved them. But I am apprehensive about ordering any more.
customer_reviews.author: linda

customer_reviews.title: Very Expensive... Amazon is robbing us...
customer_reviews.text: One star because these are so expensive... Otherwise I love them. My complaint about the price is that every now and then the price will drop to about $8.50. That seems like a fair price... It's either Amazon or the manufacturer who are robbing their customers. Wish the price could be reduced if bought in bulk ...
customer_reviews.author: Seth Anderson

customer_reviews.title: My dog likes them
customer_reviews.text: My dog really seems to like these treats so far. I am unimpressed with the packaging - I opened up my amazon box & the entire top of the bag was open, it looked like it had never been sealed shut. Very weird. Or maybe it’s so hot out it melted the glue? Still.... not cool. Hoping there is nothing wrong with them. My dog is kind of picky but had no problems sticking his head in the open bag & to pull a treat out when turned around to grab my phone to take a picture of how the bag came.
customer_reviews.author: Tocahontas

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy these treats from Amazon!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: 5stars for Old Mother Hubbard treats. However, DO NOT PURCHASE from Amazon. This is the second order in a row that the bags had ripped at the seam, spilling the contents. The air bubble packing, was just lauded on top of the whole order. Worst part is there was a book in my order that was to be a gift, the cover is ripped, and the crumbs from the dog treats were all through the book, leaving greasy spots. So disgusted with Amazon at this point, Poor packing has become the norm.
customer_reviews.author: Justahkr

customer_reviews.title: ~~Boxer Pups like these....~~
customer_reviews.text: I have two Boxer pups and am always searching for a new treat for them. These are crunchy and have a peanut butter taste to them. Both pups liked these and I will order again. Delivered to my door so it doesn't get any better than that for me. I live 40 minutes away from a grocery store so most important to have delivery. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Serenity...

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves them.
customer_reviews.text: Dog loves them. The only hard large treat that she likes we have tried a multitude of others, But when arrives the treats are mostly broken pieces. My dog like to be handed a entire treat then runs to her spot under the dining table to eat it. She savors each and every bite. But with only multiple pieces not as enjoyable for her or us (pet owners). What a shame they can't be shipped another way.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie L. Walker

customer_reviews.title: OK for some
customer_reviews.text: Out of all my dogs (7) the one with bad teeth who I bought this for didn't like the flavor. He is only 4 lbs and perhaps that is the problem. The other dogs range from 20-75lbs. eat this readily but not sure they even chew- just swallow it whole. Dont know if it is the flavor or the hardness of the cookie.
customer_reviews.author: Suz

customer_reviews.title: Was skeptical
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that my dog wasn't gonna care for these but after she had a couple she loved them. My puppers will normally take these style treats and run off to eat them but these I can use for training they're small enough she feels confident in eating them had the bag for a month she still loves them and they haven't gone bad in anyway
customer_reviews.author: Sean Thomas Asher

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for fussy pups
customer_reviews.text: My dog LOVES these biscuits. She’s usually really fussy with treats so we were really pleased when she liked the Old Mother Hubbard biscuits as they’ve been really consistent with quality. It’s also nice that there’s several flavors so my dog doesn’t get bored of one. This is a good sized bag and lasts us around 2-3 months
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: My Mini-Doxie Loves Them!
customer_reviews.text: I use these for standard treats for my miniature dachshund when he goes outside to do his business, and he loves them! He'll often run back to me in the kitchen just to make sure I'm not going to give him two treats instead of just one! These are the perfect size for small dogs, and my Zeke absolutely adores the taste!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Not the teeny biscuits I thought they were
customer_reviews.text: My dog really likes Mother Hubbard dog biscuits however she is a 10 lb senior & although small, these are still bigger & thicker than the ones I have bought in the past making them hard for her to chew. Don't know if they still make biscuits smaller than these.
customer_reviews.author: Karen A.

customer_reviews.title: Great price for about 55 treats.  So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: FYI...20oz. Bag has about 55 small treats in it as you can see from the picture. I only had a few broken bones which is to be expected. Some reviews talked about bugs in with the treats, mine didn't have any. As for the diarrhea in other reviews I'll have to wait and see. They are a perfect size treat for my yellow lab. She gobbled it up, but then again there isn't much she won't eat :)
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Dogs Like
customer_reviews.text: My Romayne likes these treats(except not so fond of the chicken ones). My neighbor's 2 pups also like like(including the chicken) as do the neighborhood pups who are familiar that I always have treats in my pocket and like to stop & visit. What more can you ask of treats?
customer_reviews.author: SEAN T

customer_reviews.title: Great treats!
customer_reviews.text: Our furbabies love these and they are a great value for the money! The ingredients are healthy so I don't worry about them getting sick. Our babies love them and show absolutely no signs of distress or irritation. I have already ordered their second sack.
customer_reviews.author: debsdunit

customer_reviews.title: All my dogs have loved them!
customer_reviews.text: I myself like that there are very few ingredients in these biscuits, and the ingredients that are in there are familiar, and you can pronounce them. I feel better about feeding them to my dogs as opposed to biscuits with questionable meat products and who knows what else. My dog likes them because he loves peanut butter more than anything in the world. It’s a win-win. I often put the large biscuit inside a JW Hol-ee Roller ball and that way he not only gets a treat but he gets to do some problem solving brain work and I get to run to the bathroom for three minutes in peace. All-in-all 10/10 recommend.
customer_reviews.author: McShadster

customer_reviews.title: Great Dane loves it!
customer_reviews.text: These are the only biscuits I trust to give my dog. We have a Great Dane and have been giving these to him since he was a puppy. They actually smell like peanut butter and my Great Dane will never get sick of them! Great quality, and 2 bags lasts us about a month.
customer_reviews.author: Katie H

customer_reviews.title: My dogs have loved the Old Mother Hubbard treats for a long time
customer_reviews.text: My dogs have loved the Old Mother Hubbard treats for a long time. This bag is really big and will last for a long time. I have small dogs, so the mini cookies are just the right treat size. I haven't seen that they prefer one flavor over another in this assorted pack. I do wish they had included the P-Nuttier flavor in this mix, though, because when I buy them individually, they enjoy that flavor the most.
customer_reviews.author: Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth the money! My dogs love the PB flavor.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love the peanut butter flavored biscuits! I make hone made ones that they love too but these are easier and cheaper than hone made. They are a substantial size so they’re fit a larger dog. My two are 89 lbs each. The bag is huge and they are worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: AEC

customer_reviews.title: Yummy dog treats
customer_reviews.text: The dogs love them. For the size my dogs are, I thought small would be like the last ones I purchased, but these are bigger, so have to break them in half, otherwise I would of given a 5. The breaking them in half sometimes can make a big mess because they crumble. But like I said, the dogs love them, thats what counts. The price was right as well.
customer_reviews.author: P. WaltonTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Surprised My Dog Doesn't Like Them
customer_reviews.text: I thought my dog would like the bacon cheese flavor, but surprisingly not. They are easy to break apart and I will sometimes mix them up in her food. If she is hungry enough, she will eat them, but doesn't love them. As for packaging, it would be nice if it had a seal to close the bag for freshness, but it doesn't. If my dog loved them, that wouldn't be a big deal, but I ordered another brand of biscuits that my dog likes and also has a resealable bag. They seem like a well-made product; maybe just my dog doesn't care for the taste.
customer_reviews.author: Always Shopping

customer_reviews.title: Yummy treats
customer_reviews.text: Someone really likes these treats. I bring them with me to our play dates at the diggie park and all the dogs are attracted to me. Lol. Great price and plenty in the bag. I break them in half so he can get more treats per day. They are very handy in training.
customer_reviews.author: joan champanis

customer_reviews.title: 2 Paws Up!  Good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these! I like that they seem so nutritious compared to most of the other brands I've been buying at the big box stores. I got the giant size and some small ones, and they all seem great. My 60 pound dog loves them and can really get a good chew out of the big cookie! Makes me feel good to give him something so substantial, too. The little treats are good for a little treat, and these, well, they are like a full on dessert for my guys. 5 stars and 2 paws up!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazonaholic

customer_reviews.title: dog loves them ...However
customer_reviews.text: have gotten over 40lbs of these over the past couple of years , but this last order was not good. Bones were pieces not whole. Bag was not damaged. Looked like product was at end run or something, bones were only Half risen but fully baked
customer_reviews.author: dbm248

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these. We've tried them in a few flavors and she has enjoyed all of them. She can be picky, so when she likes a treat, it's definitely a compliment. She also has quite a sensitive stomach, and these have not caused any issues at all which I appreciate. They are the perfect size for my 6lb chihuahua, though she does have to bite them into 2-3 pieces in order to eat them. Sometimes I will break them in 2-3 pieces to use as treats. They don't get hard or dry. I have already repurchased these a couple times and plan to continue doing so!
customer_reviews.author: KelC

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves them!
customer_reviews.text: I like that the treats are baked, grain free, and made with carrots and pumpkin. My dog loves the taste!
customer_reviews.author: Terry Ortega & Danell Templeton

customer_reviews.title: Puppy no eat
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps it is more suitable for older dogs, but 10 week old puppy no likee. We tried breaking it into smaller pieces. She reluctantly ate some after we dunked it in water. Puppy sniffed it and refused to accept it, she prefers milkbone.
customer_reviews.author: Solo Pilot

customer_reviews.title: One Of Our Favorite Dog Treats!
customer_reviews.text: We love all of the Mother Hubbard dog treats. They are made with quality ingredients. We love that we can snap the larger bones in half. Our large lab loves all of the different flavors. This is our go to dog treat.
customer_reviews.author: Janellemp

customer_reviews.title: Haven't seen a dog yet that can resist these delicious peanut butter treats
customer_reviews.text: I need to buy a whole bunch of these my dog absolutely loves them and they don't make his poop stink so it's unbearable to pick up these are a great great great treat for dogs in training because they just can't get enough of these. My personal dog loves these and my four Foster dogs can't get enough of them.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Two paws up!! ok, maybe four paws up!
customer_reviews.text: So far the dogs are giving a two paws up for these treats. I keep them on hand for visiting pooches. We don't have dogs right now but love them. So when a neighbor comes by with theirs or we need a doggie gift, I am ready with these healthy treats. The dogs know where to drag their owners for a treat!
customer_reviews.author: Sue B.

product_meta.title: Old Mother Hubbard Classic Crunchy Natural Dog Treats
product_meta.description: Style:Mini| Flavor Name:New Grain Free P-Nuttier 'N Nanners| Size:Mini Biscuits, 16-Ounce BagOur grain free biscuits are crafted to be a cupboard classic your dog will love! These oven-baked snacks are crafted from time honored recipes with all-natural ingredients, natural flavors, and a delicious crunch your dog will love
feature_bullets: Grain Free: Crunchy Everyday Grain Free Treat, Packed With The Delicious Taste Of Peanut Butter And Bananas
All Natural: Contains Only Premium, All Natural Ingredients With No Artificial Preservatives
Treating Or Training: Fun, Delicious Crunchy Bone Shape Dog Biscuits Great For Everyday Treating Or Training
Trusted For Over 90 Years: Since 1926 Old Mother Hubbard Has Been Baking Wholesome, Tasty Recipes With All Natural Ingredients

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
